Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location.... but choose your room”
Reviews.Author: Waddlerstrikesback
Reviews.Content: Service is great and staff are friendly. Rooms are spacious and if you book in advance in time, you can get a reasonable deal. 3 minutes walk to La Rambla and Plaza Catalunya....and a couple of Metro stops. Bottled water and tea/coffee are free. Only reservation is some noise at the front of the hotel from a bar/Restaraunt across the road and services outside during the night...get a room on the fifth floor and AT THE BACK. You won't have a view but you will sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Evgeny_Guy
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, friendly staff, close to all the central attractions in Barcelona - just 5 minutes of walking from Universitat or Placa Catalunya Metro stations. The rooms in modern style, with comfortable bed, safe and big shower. The hotel provides mineral water unlimitedly. Needs to be improved: no minibar in the room, and the assortment of food in breakfast (which is is poor, we've stayed 4 nights, each morning was the same food). But generally this is a strongly recommend hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: SolicitorGirl
Reviews.Content: Booked our week's stay based on the price and reviews and could not fault the hotel. We had seen previous reviewers warning about breakins but we had no experience of this and had a great time overall. The free water and the wifi was great. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as there were so many small bakeries nearby that served the best sandwiches I've ever had. The location is fantastic and every where a tourist would need to go is easily accessible on foot or using the metro, of which there are many stations nearby. Bit of advice, simply avoid eating on las ramblas. On the first night we arrived quite late and not having our bearings picked the nicest looking tapas bar. We were extremely disappointed with the food and the bill came to €85 for seven small dishes and two glasses of wine. Lesson learned!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for visiting Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraCCanada
Reviews.Content: Centrally located at 2 minutes walk to La Ramblas and the close to 2 metro stations, this was the ideal spot for a night in Barcelona prior to taking a cruise. In addition it is walking distance to the Colom monument at the end of La Ramblas where we took the shuttle bus to our ship...not taxi, no public transportation needed. The hotel is boutique style on a pedestrian street so is very quiet. Room was small but adequate and very clean. There was no window to the outside but a window onto a funnel in the middle of hotel leading to a skylight gave the illusion of outside light; very clever. The reception area is small and doubles as the breakfast nook in the mornings. Breakfast was basic self-serve continental however there were several pastry shops close by so we chose to go to one for coffee and fresh pastry. The staff were friendly and helpful and there was a fridge with free water in the lobby; a very nice touch. They provided small as well as large bottles. The hotel rooms carried a warning about potential scams while in Barcelona which proved to be prophetic for us in this city of petty crime aimed at tourists. At €129 per night (room only), this hotel was not cheap for off season but location was worth the extra money. We were able to get to the hotel by taking the airport bus to Plaça Universitat and walking from there. We would use this hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Balmoral99
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very nice rooftop terrace with a little swimming pool, location is perfect to see everything around, Piccaso Museum - just two steps from the hotel - must see. It was very enjoyable stay with my family. P.S. Buffet breakfast - very good.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: mariportal
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel, in a very old building, but very modern inside. The room is great: good and new bed, clean bathroom and very clean and modern furniture and accessories. There is a Jacuzzi on the top floor, in a very pleasant spot, with a good view, perfect place to relax in the end of the day. There is a computer on the hall with internet, as well a freezer with water in bottles, and a coffee machine: all courtesy for the guests. Good breakfast and good location. Negative points: staff unprepared in general; shower unregulated, with very hot jets, which almost burned me.

Reviews.Title: “Good but quite dirty”
Reviews.Author: mariajoaa
Reviews.Content: Ciutat Vella is a very well situated hotel although in a noisy neighborhood. Staff are really friendly and helpfull. They offer bottles of water that you can bring to your room or even take for the day, a very good point due to the bad taste of Barcelona's water. We arrived at night, so we found the room very nice; good matress, big beds, and big bathroom. Everything was great until the day came and we realized that the wallpainting was really dirty, as well as the balcony blinds. Bathroom and sheets were alright, but we didn't keep a very good impression. There is a jacuzzi at the terrace, but we didn't see it. Also we find the hotel a bit expensive, In general, when compared with other hotels in Barcelona, I will go back to that one...

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: MelBorges
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel Ciutat Vella on the internet. Based on pictures, location and prices, I booked a room. My husband was a little reluctant, but as soon as we got there, it proved to be the best decision ever. The hotel is new, the rooms are clean, and beds are comfortable. There is a LCD TV set in the bedroom and coffee and water are free in the lobby. The rooms have air-conditioning and the décor is pretty modern. Not to mention the location, for the hotel is close to the Ramblas and to Plaza de Catalunya (huge subway station and comercial center). A wonderful surprise. I definitely recommend it if you're going to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: stickan84
Reviews.Content: This charming little hotel has a lot going for it. The location is excellent right in the middle of town within at most a 5 minute walk from the hectic start of Las Ramblas and the Place de Catalunya, 15min to the heart of Old Town, and 30min to the oceanfront. The rooms are decent size compared to European standards, contemporarily furnished, spotless, and with comfortable beds. The TV offering, however, is very limited for English speakers, and there is no view from the room. We very lucky enough though to have a room on the 1st floor, which means that you also gain access to a very large private patio complete with table and chairs- perfect for sitting and having a glass of wine. Added perks of staying at the Ciutat Vella are a very friendly staff, a beautiful (although cold) rooftop jacuzzi, and sun deck with views over the city, unlimited free access to ice-cool bottled water, and free access to a computer with internet (although it is often occupied). Overall a definite recommendation for any traveler hoping to get the most out of a visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good simple hotel in central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: junkbuzz
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in P.de Gracia area on business, but this was a family trip. 3 of us in family room, a bit cramped as they just put an extra bed in a double room, but it was ok. Location was great for Plz. Catalunya, lower Ramblas, and Boqueria market. Some funky shops close by, tatoo parlors, record shops, but also good bakery and coffee shops close as well. Bit noisy at night, but it's central Barcelona so what else to expect! Good AC in room to arrive back to a cool room after the heat of summer. Free water and coffee was a great perk and much appreciated. Staff was friendly. Luggage storage available if needed. Wifi worked fine. Breakfast was cheaper than most hotels and adequate. Booked room directly with hotel with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Barcelona? - stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Hels082
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location - minutes from La Ramblas and the Barri Gotic, experience the bohemium side to everyday living in Barcelona. You are located next to the University, the street is buzzing by day and relatively quiet by night, benefiting from cool, trendy bars with great cocktail happy hours only minutes away. Hotel location: Very safe, excellent choice of bars, restaurants, patisseries, shops nearby. This is THE location for holidaying on foot. Get the Renfe train from the airport, 3 stops to Psg de Gracia (not the nearest to the hotel but well worth the 5 min walk) to experience your first views of Barcelona City. If feeling adventurous and looking for an alternative to the open-top bus, hire a scooter - local hire shop recommended by the very friendly and helpful hotel staff. Then sooth the saddle-sore in the roof-top jacuzzi - a great location to watch the sunset. Facilities: Jacuzzi, sun loungers, wifi - not great signal in room (4th floor) as router in ground floor Reception, communal computer and printer for guest use, Free chilled bottled water in Reception. Rooms VERY clean, spatious, maid service ans new towels daily. Air con - close shutters at night, to dim the noise of the early morning glass refuse collection outside. Would recommned this hotel to individuals, couples, groups, business users alike

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotal”
Reviews.Author: Josse
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona from 13/03 to 18/03/2011. When we arrived at the hotel, first impression of the neighbourhood was "where the hell did they drop us". The buildings are tagged with grafiti and looked desolate. Once inside the hotel, things were different. Very friendly staff, clean and, for a city, large rooms. Since the hotel is on a side street of the Ramblas, the noise was very limited. Breakfast is quite extensive: a selection of cheeses, cold cuts, cereals, yoghurt, ... nothing hot although. Internet is free: a computer stands at your disposal and bottles of water are also free (to be taken out of a fridge).

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: CCfos
Reviews.Content: Clean and cozy hotel, in a great location. Very helpful personnel.

Reviews.Title: “good location clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: rasim78
Reviews.Content: location is very good.hotel is very clean and staff is helpfull.hotel`s breakfast is poor and at room there isnt clocg.otherwise I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again -- perfect base in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: travelling_is_bliss
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was central, fit my budget and the online reviews were good. It lived up to the reviews. The location was wonderful and the hotel itself was lovely. I would say, however, that I'd go for a double room next time. I had booked a single, which was small and had no outside window. It got a bit stuffy but if I opened the window to the interior courtyard, a lot of noise came in. My friends had a double, which was spacious and even had a small balcony -- for maybe 10 or 15 more Euros per night. They did comment that the walls were paper thin and they could hear every word that was said in the next room. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, but there were any number of great options in the vicinity. It was the perfect place to base myself for my first trip to Barcelona -- on days when I felt like taking it easy, there was plenty to do in the immediate neighbourhood (like MACBA, the modern art gallery) and the hotel itself (like the roof terrace.) On other days, I could stroll down Las Ramblas to the port or venture further afield through the nearby metro stations very easily. The free wifi was also a bonus. Can't wait to get back to Barcelona and I definitely plan to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but perfect to visit Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Mos0264
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 5 minutes walk from Les Rambles and Placa Catalunya, the heart of Barcelona, where the Metro and many buses (all night buses) interchange. Rooms are not large but VERY clean and well equipped for a 3star-hotel. Staff always helpful. 24 hour reception. Water bottles free all the time, tea and coffee from 3p.m. Most rooms do not face the street so they are quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kittykat1978
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for a long weekend. I had organised it as a surprise for his birthday and was having difficulty finding a reasonably priced hotel in a central location as it was a bank holiday in Spain and thus the city was really busy. Luckily after much searching, I found this hotel on Octopus travel at a cost of approx £93 a night room only. The hotel is quite like quite a trendy hostel in its decoration and layout. We had a room facing into the inner courtyard and it was perfectly quiet. The bed is comfortable, the room was clean, we had a tv and the bathroom was spotless with a good shower. We were out and about for most of the day and evening so didn't spend much time in the room. The staff are very nice and friendly, check in and check out was faultless and they kept our bags for us for the day when we checked out in a secure room. There is also free coffee and free water available in the lobby. As to the location, it is located in between the metro stops of Universitat and Cataluynya, within walking distance of the Ramblas. There are lots of little bars and cafes nearby. It's not a luxury hotel but is perfect for a weekend in Barcelona. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: wisechildVan
Reviews.Content: + great location - so close to La Rambla, Plaza Catalunya, the Metro, the Contemporary Art Museum + simple, clean, modern style + free water, free computer access, wi-fi + rooftop terrace for sunbathing, and jacuzzi + the staff are all so good-looking ;) and helpful. They were able to get us on the guest list at any of the nightclubs we wanted to go to. + great value + close to great restaurants and shopping

Reviews.Title: “Great location + Very clean + Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PortugalTravelerP
Reviews.Content: The hotel Ciutat Vella has a great location, being a 2 min walk from the Rambla. It’s a simple hotel, with the basics, but very clean. Staff is very helpful and friendly. I’ve read some reviews about thefts at this hotel, but we had no problem. The room had a safe, so you just need to be careful and put your belongings on the safe or on your luggage (if you can close with a code or padlock). We stayed in a quadruple room that was transformed in a twin room – not the most beautiful room in the world, but the beds are comfortable and the room and bathroom were always clean. Mainly, you get the basics of a hotel, not much luxury, but it’s ideal for those who want to walk around Barcelona and profit the most of the city, since it’s very central and you have the metro station of Plaça Catlunya at 3 min walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “No doubts. Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: marty-panama
Reviews.Content: This was not only a great value but a really great place. The rooms were simple but always clean. The staff was friendly and welcoming and gave plenty of good recommendations, especially for food. I ate at some wonderful restaurants that aren't listed in any of the guide books. They also have a giant fridge full of free bottles of water. This might sound unimportant, but it actually ended up being a really great feature. No need to go out to buy bottles of water if you don't want to drink the tap water in your room. If you're going to be out the entire day in the city or on a day trip you can get your water right at the hotel for free. A small thing but a really nice one. The location is perfect, right in the heart of the city. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and loved the Jacuzzi!”
Reviews.Author: Elise B
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here for 2 nights as the electrics fused in our rented apartment. Went to Tourism Office under Plaza Catalunya and they got it for €70 an night for us. First impressions were definitely 'Wow'! as it was so boutiquey. Friendly receptionist who explained everything to us. Didn't pay for breakfast as there are so many bars that do Desayuno Continentale for about €3.60 just around the corner. The room was nice and big with comfy twin beds. It looked onto the central columny bit so no street noise. AC was excellent after a stuffy apartment with only a fan :) I went up to try the Jacuzzi in the afternoon and it was so nice to sit in there in the sun. Unfortunately a large family also joined me so I left after getting fed up with small children crawling all over me. This is in a great location as well, just around the corner from the Barri Gotic and Paza Catalunya. Didn't suffer from any noise in the room and the staff were excellent as was the free internet access in the rooms and pc downstairs with printer for boarding cards.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with central location”
Reviews.Author: M0sa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in the center, close to the Ramblas and metro Universitad. The room was rather small but clean and a good bed. The staff was very helpfull, breakfast is OK for the price. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really great stay”
Reviews.Author: JixCo_Clare
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Barcelona and this was by far the best hotel I have stayed in. Its a leisurely 10 minute stroll from Las Ramblas. The rooms have a modern trendy look and are quite large for a city centre hotel and everything was clean and in good repair. The rooftop area is an added bonus and is an ideal place to chill out after a day of walking around while you sip on a drink and ponder upon dinner options. Breakfast was ample and the evening menu looked quite good however we didnt eat there in the evening. I loved the location of the hotel, the area its in , seems that bit more authentic than Las Ramblas and you can sit in the many cafes around a glass of wine and some tapas and watch the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base to discover the city”
Reviews.Author: YmkeB
Reviews.Content: We (group of 6 friends) stayed here after Christmas. Great place. Very design-modern (as such not very spanish at all). Staff was very friendly and helpfull. Rooms may differ. We had 3 and all were different in size. No outside noice coming in, only a bit loud when our neighbours got home in the middle of the night. Jacuzzi on the roofterrace but only open in summer (we should come back to discover that one). Hotel is in small street just off the Ramblas. Can be reached easy, from airport with bus to Plaza Catalunya and then 10 min. walk. We did not book for breakfast at hotel but decided to find some typical Spanish cafeteria. Area is very touristy, but there are some nice places around where they don't bomb you with their " english breakfast". The hotel offers free bottles of water (in summer even better), room has free locker. In all, we had a great time, perfect place to stay (too bad about the weather ).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for practical travellers”
Reviews.Author: LaurenA1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for two nights during July and found the hotel to be pretty much as its shown on the website - whihc is a good thing. The room was a decent size, fairly basic in that it consisted of a bed, desk and chair, but then that is exactly what we expected. The decor - all red, white and black gives a clean, modern atmosphere. There is also a safe in each room and loads of power points - handly for computers/ipods/phones etc. The staff we encountered could not be described as super-friendly but were certainly polite and attentive. The location is great - the northern part of El Raval so on a narrow street packed with funky music and clothes shops as well as some cheaper cafes and bars, but also less than 5 mins walk to Las Ramblas and into the Gothic Quarter or north into the rest of the city. I did notice a few things that didn't really bother us in the end but would certainly bother others: - the AC seemed to have two settings - Arctic or off; - the corridors smell very strongly of cigarette smoke (although our room was fine); - there was some street noise in our room on the second floor - people during the night and traffic (seemed to be a lot of trucks loading and unloading) during the day so earplugs are recommended if you're a light sleeper; and - the lifts take an age to arrive so we usually took the stairs. But overall I'd recommend this to travellers, especially younger travellers who like somewhere more upmarket than the hostels who might appreciate the modernity and basic aesthetic of the place.

Reviews.Title: “A Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: EF20
Reviews.Content: After a very, very long research I decided to choose this hotel for our 5 day trip in Barcelona, and I am very happy that I did so. Hotel Ciutat Vella is a new hotel, situated very close to placa catalunya, on the border between Raval and L'eixample- perfect. In spite of the central location, it's situated in a narrow, beautiful street- and yes, a quiet one! Our room faced the street, and we had a nice little balcony that allowed us to sit and enjoy the liveliness of the street when we wanted to, and to sleep quietly once we shut the doors. The Universitat Metro station was exactly 1 minute walk from the hotel, and it was extremely comfortable. buy the T10 ticket at the ticket machine! The room was not big but just big enough, with a desk, daily room cleaning service, TV, closet, reading lamps, a balcony, a safe and a bath. one afternoon we discovered that our key (which is a card) stopped working and that anyone could enter our room easily just by opening the door. The man at the reception was extremely helpful and fixed the problem immediately. There's a jacuzzi at the top floor, with a nice view- it was fun even though the water was lukewarm! There's free internet access at the computer at the lobby, complimentary water, coffee and sometimes a pastry too! we didn't have breakfast at the hotel since there were so many appealing - and cheaper- options at the streets. This is a new and comfortable hotel not yet discovered by the masses.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Ciutat Vella
HotelInfo.Address: Carrer Tallers 66, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
